text: The Fu'an dialect () is a dialect of Eastern Min, which is a branch of Min Chinese spoken mainly in the eastern part of Fujian Province. The Fu'an dialect covers two city and three counties: Ningde, Fu'an, Shouning, Zhouning and Zherong County. == Phonology == Fu'an dialect has 18 initials, 50 rimes and 7 tones. === Initials === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- ! bgcolor="#ABCDEF" | The Coda of the Former Syllable ! bgcolor="#ABCDEF" | The initial assimilation of the Latter Syllable |- | Null coda | *, and change to null initial; *, and change to null initial, or . |- | coda | *, change to ; *, change to ; *, and change to ; *, and change to , or . |- | coda | *, change to ; *, and change to null initial; *, and change to null initial, or . |- |} === Anticipatory assimilation === === Tone sandhi === The two-syllable tonal sandhi rules are shown in the table below (the rows give the first syllable's original citation tone, while the columns give the citation tone of the second syllable): {|class=wikitable |- | | bgcolor="#BBFFFF"|dark level 332 | bgcolor="#BBFFFF"|light level 22 | bgcolor="#BBFFFF"|rising 42 | bgcolor="#BBFFFF"|dark departing 35 | bgcolor="#BBFFFF"|light departing 23 | bgcolor="#BBFFFF"|dark entering 5 | bgcolor="#BBFFFF"|light entering 2 |- | bgcolor="#FFBBFF"|dark level 332 | | |55 |55 |44 | |44 |- | bgcolor="#FFBBFF"|light level 22 |332 | |style="background:lightgreen"|35+42 |55 |44 | |44 |- | bgcolor="#FFBBFF"|rising 42 |style="background:lightgreen"|23+332 | |style="background:lightgreen"|35+42 |55 |44 | |44 |- | bgcolor="#FFBBFF"|dark departing 35 | | |55 |55 |44 | |44 |- | bgcolor="#FFBBFF"|light departing 23 | | |55 |55 |44 | |44 |- | bgcolor="#FFBBFF"|dark entering 5 | | |55 |55 |44 | |44 |- | bgcolor="#FFBBFF"|light entering 2 | | |style="background:lightgreen"|35+5 |55 |44 | |44 |- |} ==References== *.
